blog.name: popfizzles
blog.title: You can call me Fizzles!
blog.description:
Asks: Open
Submissions: Open
Commissions: Open
Art Trades: Closed

Pronouns: She/He/They
Anxiety: Getting Better!

Games: Not Enough
Fictional Crushes: Too Many

Hi, I'm Fizzles! I'm a 20 year old, genderfluid, fandom hopping cartoonist. I'm that wild son of a gun who draws Mugman jacked as shit. Right now I'm really into MC:SM! Take a load off and stay a while, I'll be here.

summary: my favourite thing about the fact that ryan reynolds is voicing detective pikachu is the fact that it sounds like a complete...
body:
my favourite thing about the fact that ryan reynolds is voicing detective pikachu is the fact that it sounds like a complete joke when you first hear it. like when it was announced everyone thought it was a joke. i have a friend that literally thought it was a joke until we went to the movies and the trailer played.

“wait ryan reynolds is voicing detective pikachu???”

“yeah you didn’t hear that?”

“I did. I just… thought it was a joke.”

blog.name: tired-pokemon-boi
blog.title: It's not a Religion
blog.description:
It's Pokemon.            
Alex. He/Him. This blog only consist of Pokemon content, my fanfiction writing, my art, and so much more!

summary: Pokemon FanFiction Chapter 4 part 2: Our First Battle. A Sticky Situation
title: Pokemon FanFiction Chapter 4 part 2: Our First Battle. A Sticky Situation
body:
Bethany sat on the side of the clearing as the two moved far enough apart to start their battle. For once since they started this walk, Bethany noticed that the small golden lizard wasn’t wandering around and not listening to Alex, but instead actually listening and getting ready for the battle. She watched as he crouched down to eye level with Igneel, directing him and telling him where to stand and probably giving them some idea of a strategy. She smiled, they were kind of cute together. Wait, she thought to herself, did I just think that? She shook her head, let’s just hope this works in their favor she thought to herself as put her chin in her cupped hands ignoring her first thought.

Wendell took out a small Pokeball from his pocket, pressed the white button so it would grow into the palm of his hand,

“Alright, now it’s time for the fun to begin,” his grin reached the corners of his face as tossed the Pokeball into the air.

“Go Weedle! [1]”        

From the Pokeball came out a reddish-brown and yellow larva. Weedle was tinier than Igneel with beady black dots for eyes, a big red and pinkish nose and large spike on the top of its head and a small one on the end of it like a tail. It made a noise like an angry groan as it came out of its Pokeball its beady black eyes narrowed and looked like it was to poke its opponent with its head spike.

Alex smirked and almost burst out laughing at Wendell’s Pokémon. This was going to be his opponent against his Charmander. This was going to be an easy first match.  

“Are you sure you want to do this?” Bethany asked from the edge of the clearing, smiling and hoping her charm would get him to say yes let’s leave now.

But Alex wasn’t listening anymore. The thrill of his first battle was the only thing on his mind now. He ignored her words, “Go, Igneel!”

The small golden lizard looked up towards his trainer, realized he needed to get into the position they had practiced and ran over to the spot. Igneel roared as menacingly as he could.

“Go ahead and start whenever you’re ready,” Wendell said his arms open and a large creepy grin across his face, his eyes also intensely looking at the battle.

Alex inhaled, he had this. He had the type advantage. Plus, a Charmander’s stats were much higher than a small little bug. Wendell had no chance of beating him. He shivered, the thrill of this battle felt so different from simulations, he couldn’t wait to get started.

He pointed his finger towards the Weedle, “Igneel use scratch!”

After briefly looking at his trainer, the Charmander turned back towards the battle and rushed forward towards the Weedle. Igneel opened its hands and his three fingered claws extended and glowed white. When he reached Weedle he slashed, but the Weedle had jumped back to avoid it. All part of the plan, Alex thought.

Remembering what Bethany said about real life battles not being like a Battle Simulator and not having to wait turn for turn,

“Now use ember!” he yelled

Igneel switched and flicked its tail forward and small embers shot out and hit the larva. It hissed in pain, small burns over some parts of its body but it still stood, its eyes narrowed and glaring at Igneel.

“Igneel again, use scratch!”

As the Charmander rushed forward Wendell issued his first attack, “Weedle, string shot!”

“Igneel, dodge!”

Also remembering Bethany telling him that you can dodge attacks even if in the simulation the moves have 100% accuracy, Igneel jumped sideways to avoid the oncoming attack, but Weedle turned its head in the opposite direction making Alex confused. Instead of launching an attack at Igneel, the small larva had shot it’s a blast of web towards one the trees around the clearing. Suddenly the Weedle sucked in and was propelled towards the tree and disappeared from Alex and Igneel’s line of sight. Not good he thought to himself.

Alex and Igneel started looking around. Where did the Weedle go?

“Igneel, stay sharp,” he told him as the Pokémon extended its white claws out.

Igneel started watching the tree line, Alex could tell the small golden lizard was scared and confused as well.

Wendell smirked as though he had already won, “Weedle, string shot.”

Suddenly from the opposite side of where the Weedle had flown to, a line of web stuck itself to Igneel’s hand and went taut. Igneel tried to pull but it couldn’t pull his hand out free.

“Again quickly!” Wendell shouted.

Another web shot out, this time in the direction they had seen the Weedle had disappeared from. It grabbed the small golden lizard’s other hand before he could cut himself free with the free hand. Before Alex could issue any commands the Weedle had begun its work, it continually shot webs from every direction, moving so fast through the tree lines until eventually, the small golden lizard was the center of a giant web and was trapped inside. He pulled and tried to burn the webs with its tail, but they were too thick.

Wendell grinned, and his left eye started to twitch, “Now the fun begins! Weedle use Poison Sting!”

Now, instead of web, small purple stingers started coming out the trees and pelting Igneel. The Charmander roared in pain as they stuck into his body, his face now flush with purple.

“He’s poisoned,” Alex said aloud.

Wendell’s smile grew larger and he began to laugh, “YES! Weedle, keep using Poison Sting!”

More and more purple needles pelted Igneel in all different directions, and Alex couldn’t tell where the Weedle ever was. The small lizard cried out in pain. Not only is he dealing with the damage from the Weedle, Alex thought, he is also dealing poison damage, this is bad. Really bad. Alex began to panic, what was he going to do?

Meanwhile as the battle continued, Bethany was getting worried. Clearly the battle was over, Igneel had clearly lost and was starting pass out but Wendell didn’t look like he was going to stop. Why? She then remembered something she read on the school reports when she got here earlier. Oh no. “This is getting out of hand, I need to do something,” she whispered to herself. She quietly left the clearing, so nobody would hear her leave.

Alex was starting to get worried now. Igneel was screaming in pain and the poison seemed to be taking its toll.

Fear was rising inside Alex but he was able to say what needed to be said, “Okay Wendell, I surrender, you win.”

Wendell had been looking down since he yelled for Weedle to keep attacking as if he was listening to the sound of the battle rather than needing to see, but suddenly his arms dropped, and he looked up at Alex, his pupils fully dilated, one eye twitching and his grin wide,

“But we aren’t done yet. Not yet. Weedle!”

Before Alex could even react, something whooshed through the trees behind him and impaled his Charmander. Alex’s eyes widened and he realized it was Weedle and it had impaled Igneel with the large spike coming from its head. Charmander choked from screaming, red blood coming out of the lizard’s mouth and oozing down its back from where Weedle had stabbed it. The small larva took its tail spike and jammed it down on Igneel’s tail. Alex watched in horror as the flame on Igneel’s tail started to flicker and start to fade. That was it.

“I said that’s enough Wendell!” and before he could wait for a reply he started to rush forward to rip Weedle off his Pokémon.

However, before he could do that he crashed into an invisible wall. A wall?    

[1] Weedle, the Hairy Bug Pokémon. Weedle is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon. Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

Another web shot out, this time in the direction they had seen the Weedle had disappeared from. It grabbed the small golden lizard’s other hand before he could cut himself free with the free hand. Before Alex could issue any commands the Weedle had begun its work, it continually shot webs from every direction, moving so fast through the tree lines until eventually, the small golden lizard was the center of a giant web and was trapped inside. He pulled and tried to burn the webs with its tail, but they were too thick.

Wendell grinned, and his left eye started to twitch, “Now the fun begins! Weedle use Poison Sting!”

Now, instead of web, small purple stingers started coming out the trees and pelting Igneel. The Charmander roared in pain as they stuck into his body, his face now flush with purple.

“He’s poisoned,” Alex said aloud.

Wendell’s smile grew larger and he began to laugh, “YES! Weedle, keep using Poison Sting!”

More and more purple needles pelted Igneel in all different directions, and Alex couldn’t tell where the Weedle ever was. The small lizard cried out in pain. Not only is he dealing with the damage from the Weedle, Alex thought, he is also dealing poison damage, this is bad. Really bad. Alex began to panic, what was he going to do?

Meanwhile as the battle continued, Bethany was getting worried. Clearly the battle was over, Igneel had clearly lost and was starting pass out but Wendell didn’t look like he was going to stop. Why? She then remembered something she read on the school reports when she got here earlier. Oh no. “This is getting out of hand, I need to do something,” she whispered to herself. She quietly left the clearing, so nobody would hear her leave.

Alex was starting to get worried now. Igneel was screaming in pain and the poison seemed to be taking its toll.

Fear was rising inside Alex but he was able to say what needed to be said, “Okay Wendell, I surrender, you win.”

Wendell had been looking down since he yelled for Weedle to keep attacking as if he was listening to the sound of the battle rather than needing to see, but suddenly his arms dropped, and he looked up at Alex, his pupils fully dilated, one eye twitching and his grin wide,

“But we aren’t done yet. Not yet. Weedle!”

Before Alex could even react, something whooshed through the trees behind him and impaled his Charmander. Alex’s eyes widened and he realized it was Weedle and it had impaled Igneel with the large spike coming from its head. Charmander choked from screaming, red blood coming out of the lizard’s mouth and oozing down its back from where Weedle had stabbed it. The small larva took its tail spike and jammed it down on Igneel’s tail. Alex watched in horror as the flame on Igneel’s tail started to flicker and start to fade. That was it.

“I said that’s enough Wendell!” and before he could wait for a reply he started to rush forward to rip Weedle off his Pokémon.

However, before he could do that he crashed into an invisible wall. A wall?    

[1] Weedle, the Hairy Bug Pokémon. Weedle is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon. Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
trail.content:
Bethany sat on the side of the clearing as the two moved far enough apart to start their battle. For once since they started this walk, Bethany noticed that the small golden lizard wasn’t wandering around and not listening to Alex, but instead actually listening and getting ready for the battle. She watched as he crouched down to eye level with Igneel, directing him and telling him where to stand and probably giving them some idea of a strategy. She smiled, they were kind of cute together. Wait, she thought to herself, did I just think that? She shook her head, let’s just hope this works in their favor she thought to herself as put her chin in her cupped hands ignoring her first thought.

Wendell took out a small Pokeball from his pocket, pressed the white button so it would grow into the palm of his hand,

“Alright, now it’s time for the fun to begin,” his grin reached the corners of his face as tossed the Pokeball into the air.

“Go Weedle! [1]”        

From the Pokeball came out a reddish-brown and yellow larva. Weedle was tinier than Igneel with beady black dots for eyes, a big red and pinkish nose and large spike on the top of its head and a small one on the end of it like a tail. It made a noise like an angry groan as it came out of its Pokeball its beady black eyes narrowed and looked like it was to poke its opponent with its head spike.

Alex smirked and almost burst out laughing at Wendell’s Pokémon. This was going to be his opponent against his Charmander. This was going to be an easy first match.  

“Are you sure you want to do this?” Bethany asked from the edge of the clearing, smiling and hoping her charm would get him to say yes let’s leave now.

But Alex wasn’t listening anymore. The thrill of his first battle was the only thing on his mind now. He ignored her words, “Go, Igneel!”

The small golden lizard looked up towards his trainer, realized he needed to get into the position they had practiced and ran over to the spot. Igneel roared as menacingly as he could.

“Go ahead and start whenever you’re ready,” Wendell said his arms open and a large creepy grin across his face, his eyes also intensely looking at the battle.

Alex inhaled, he had this. He had the type advantage. Plus, a Charmander’s stats were much higher than a small little bug. Wendell had no chance of beating him. He shivered, the thrill of this battle felt so different from simulations, he couldn’t wait to get started.

He pointed his finger towards the Weedle, “Igneel use scratch!”

After briefly looking at his trainer, the Charmander turned back towards the battle and rushed forward towards the Weedle. Igneel opened its hands and his three fingered claws extended and glowed white. When he reached Weedle he slashed, but the Weedle had jumped back to avoid it. All part of the plan, Alex thought.

Remembering what Bethany said about real life battles not being like a Battle Simulator and not having to wait turn for turn,

“Now use ember!” he yelled

Igneel switched and flicked its tail forward and small embers shot out and hit the larva. It hissed in pain, small burns over some parts of its body but it still stood, its eyes narrowed and glaring at Igneel.

“Igneel again, use scratch!”

As the Charmander rushed forward Wendell issued his first attack, “Weedle, string shot!”

“Igneel, dodge!”

Also remembering Bethany telling him that you can dodge attacks even if in the simulation the moves have 100% accuracy, Igneel jumped sideways to avoid the oncoming attack, but Weedle turned its head in the opposite direction making Alex confused. Instead of launching an attack at Igneel, the small larva had shot it’s a blast of web towards one the trees around the clearing. Suddenly the Weedle sucked in and was propelled towards the tree and disappeared from Alex and Igneel’s line of sight. Not good he thought to himself.

Alex and Igneel started looking around. Where did the Weedle go?

“Igneel, stay sharp,” he told him as the Pokémon extended its white claws out.

Igneel started watching the tree line, Alex could tell the small golden lizard was scared and confused as well.

Wendell smirked as though he had already won, “Weedle, string shot.”

Suddenly from the opposite side of where the Weedle had flown to, a line of web stuck itself to Igneel’s hand and went taut. Igneel tried to pull but it couldn’t pull his hand out free.

“Again quickly!” Wendell shouted.

Another web shot out, this time in the direction they had seen the Weedle had disappeared from. It grabbed the small golden lizard’s other hand before he could cut himself free with the free hand. Before Alex could issue any commands the Weedle had begun its work, it continually shot webs from every direction, moving so fast through the tree lines until eventually, the small golden lizard was the center of a giant web and was trapped inside. He pulled and tried to burn the webs with its tail, but they were too thick.

Wendell grinned, and his left eye started to twitch, “Now the fun begins! Weedle use Poison Sting!”

Now, instead of web, small purple stingers started coming out the trees and pelting Igneel. The Charmander roared in pain as they stuck into his body, his face now flush with purple.

“He’s poisoned,” Alex said aloud.

Wendell’s smile grew larger and he began to laugh, “YES! Weedle, keep using Poison Sting!”

More and more purple needles pelted Igneel in all different directions, and Alex couldn’t tell where the Weedle ever was. The small lizard cried out in pain. Not only is he dealing with the damage from the Weedle, Alex thought, he is also dealing poison damage, this is bad. Really bad. Alex began to panic, what was he going to do?

Meanwhile as the battle continued, Bethany was getting worried. Clearly the battle was over, Igneel had clearly lost and was starting pass out but Wendell didn’t look like he was going to stop. Why? She then remembered something she read on the school reports when she got here earlier. Oh no. “This is getting out of hand, I need to do something,” she whispered to herself. She quietly left the clearing, so nobody would hear her leave.

Alex was starting to get worried now. Igneel was screaming in pain and the poison seemed to be taking its toll.

Fear was rising inside Alex but he was able to say what needed to be said, “Okay Wendell, I surrender, you win.”

Wendell had been looking down since he yelled for Weedle to keep attacking as if he was listening to the sound of the battle rather than needing to see, but suddenly his arms dropped, and he looked up at Alex, his pupils fully dilated, one eye twitching and his grin wide,

“But we aren’t done yet. Not yet. Weedle!”

Before Alex could even react, something whooshed through the trees behind him and impaled his Charmander. Alex’s eyes widened and he realized it was Weedle and it had impaled Igneel with the large spike coming from its head. Charmander choked from screaming, red blood coming out of the lizard’s mouth and oozing down its back from where Weedle had stabbed it. The small larva took its tail spike and jammed it down on Igneel’s tail. Alex watched in horror as the flame on Igneel’s tail started to flicker and start to fade. That was it.

“I said that’s enough Wendell!” and before he could wait for a reply he started to rush forward to rip Weedle off his Pokémon.

However, before he could do that he crashed into an invisible wall. A wall?    

[1] Weedle, the Hairy Bug Pokémon. Weedle is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon. Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

blog.title: Pokemon Sprites
blog.description:
Currently on hiatus until further notice

I also enjoy recoloring and splicing sprites, so feel free to request custom trainer and Pokemon sprites, fusions, recolors, and teams like mine in the header image above

Please ask before using any of my sprites, unless you are the person who specifically asked for them, thank you

summary: I always felt like they could have done better with Rattata and Raticate. So, here we have a green Rattata and a blue Raticate!...
caption: I always felt like they could have done better with Rattata and Raticate. So, here we have a green Rattata and a blue Raticate! I liked these colors more than the originals, and it contrasts the non-shinies as well.
